data.title: Refugees from Nicaragua: Figures and development
data.meta_description: 88,360 asylum applications made by refugees from Nicaragua in 2023. A list by countries receiving most of them.
data.text:
Asylum applications and refugees from Nicaragua

88,360 people from Nicaragua fled in 2023 and applied for asylum in other countries, according to UNHCR data. This corresponds to approximately 1.254% of all residents. The most common destination countries have been the United States, Costa Rica and Spain. The most successful have been the refugees in the Netherlands and in Brazil.

A total of 52,933 people fled to the United States from Nicaragua. With 59 positive decisions, 33.91 percent of all new applications have been accepted. Another 115 applications were rejected, and no decisions were made on those remaining in 2023.
